caption.p: Kaplan–Meier curves showing the proportions of SARS-CoV-2 RNA-positive patients. T1 refers to the duration from the symptom onset to the day when SARS-CoV-2 RNA was negative for two consecutive times, which was considered to indicate an undetectable viral RNA level. a) All patients (n=410). b) Patients with (n=27) and without (n=383) coronary heart disease; p=0.029. c) Patients with albumin levels <35 g·L −1 (n=193) and ≥35 g·L −1 (n=217); p=0.032. d) Patients who started antiviral therapy >7 days (n=128) and ≤7 days (n=278) after symptom onset; p<0.001.
